title: How To Configure MCP Servers in iMash
lede: This guide explains how to create and connect an MCP (Modular Control Point) server in Imash, allowing your AI agents to access external tools, flows, and functions for expanded functionality.

steps.title: Access the Automation Tab
steps.content:
1. Navigate to the Automation tab (located above the Call Center).
  2. Here you will find Flows, which allow you to build complex operations out of smaller building blocks.

steps.title: Create a Flow
steps.content:
1. Click Create New Flow.
  2. Build your flow by chaining actions. For example:
    • Take a city name as input.
    • Send it via an HTTP request to retrieve weather data.
    • Extract the relevant JSON fields (e.g., temperature).
    • Return the processed result.
  3. Once complete, Publish the flow so it can be used in MCP servers.

steps.title: Create an MCP Server
steps.content:
1. In the Automation tab, go to MCP Servers and click Create New MCP.
  2. Give it a meaningful name (e.g., ‚ÄúMy MCP‚Äù).
  3. Add tools to the MCP:
    • Piece: Predefined operation or function.
    • Flow: Any published flow you have created.
  4. Select your published flow (e.g., Check Weather) and add it to the MCP.

steps.title: Attach MCP to an Agent
steps.content:
1. Go to AI Agents and select your agent.
  2. In the MCP configuration section, add the MCP you created.
  3. The agent now has access to all flows and tools within the MCP.

steps.title: Test the MCP Integration
steps.content:
1. Open the Test Window and connect to your agent.
  2. Ask a question that triggers the MCP tool (e.g., ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the weather in Paris today?‚Äù).
  3. The agent should process the request via the MCP and return the correct result.

steps.title: View MCP Usage History
steps.content:
1. Return to the Automation ‚Üí MCP section.
  2. Open the History tab of your MCP server.
  3. Here you can view:
    • Each invocation of the MCP.
    • Which tool or flow was used.
    • Inputs provided (e.g., ‚ÄúParis‚Äù).
    • Outputs and responses generated.
